page.title: 18THE SUB-POST OFFICE, ASHTON
page.content: The sub-post office at{Ashton under {Hill}is contained in an old thatched cottage that is about 400 years old. It has had several uses including a shoe repair business. All the ceilings are beamed and very low and the rooms are very small. The post office is kept very busy at a time when many others are being forced to close. Villagers are kept up to date about local events by consulting the special calender there, also using this when arranging other functions to avoid dates clashing. A large notice board is available to advertise goods for sale and situations vacant at the rate of 10 pence per week. The post office has been run by the Whitehead family for over 40 years, the present postmaster being the son. It continues to be an essential "gossip" shop for the village.
